description.narrative: Enable policy framework and capacity development for green energy SMEs and access to finance and business models for green energy SMEs and energy service users piloted in Tajikistan.

condition.narrative: UNDP as the Implementing Partner will comply with the policies, procedures and practices of the United Nations Security Management System (UNSMS.)

description.narrative: 1. Number of policy recommendations for private investments in providing green energy through SMEs developed and presented with national stakeholders 2. Number of people (disaggregated by sex and age) trained on construction, maintenance and installation of their own energy efficient cook stoves, solar thermal systems and other energy generating systems (350) 3. Number of women and men led SMEs established with support by Energy Access Centers (3) 4.1 Number of microcredit institutions and banks joining the Energy Access Fund 4.2 Number of tailor made crowdfunding products designed with crowdfunding platforms 4.3 Number of financial incentives ensuring women’s access to finance 5. Number of business models piloted with established SMEs 6.1 Number of minigrids implemented on a village level in Tajikistan (8) 6.2 Number of public buildings in villages with operational and sustainable PV and heating energy systems (15) 6.3 Number of households supported with green energy access through operational and sustainable small-scale technologies with ensured project co-financing (3750)

comment.narrative: 1. No enabling policy framework for energy access for SMEs 2. Lack of knowledge and awareness on energy access and energy efficient equipment, products and services 3. Scarce information for SMEs and their customers on affordable finance and how to access it 4. No knowledge on innovative financing mechanisms 5. No knowledge on innovative business models for SMEs 6. Access to sustainable energy services in remote rural areas not easily obtained

In addition to 2019 progress, the following results have been achieved across the project indicators in 2020. 1. 1 legislation completed. 2. 397 people trained on renewable energy technologies. 3. 3 SMEs serve as a most common businesses interested in energy access. 4.1 4 more banks identified as main collaborators for the energy access fund. 4.2 Testing of the two-crowdfunding platforms (from 2019). 4.3 Demonstration of “green loan products” (mainly for solar water heaters and solar drier equipment that are mainly used by women). 5. 2 models tested: concession and energy cooperatives/community approach. 6.1 7 (off-grid) social and public infrastructures (in the districts of Kuhistoni Mastchcoh, Vakhsh Dangara, Karatog and Shohin) implemented. 6.2 20 public buildings operationalized with sustainable PV and heating energy systems. 6.3 8175 households accessed to green energy through small scale technologies.

Tajikistan completed two legislations to support green energy implementation, working closely with SMEs and conducted trainings for 85 people. Three banks were identified as main collaborators for the energy access fund. Feasibility studies completed to implement off-grid solutions in rural areas. 1. 2 legislations completed (Energy/renewable energy legislation; Legislation on regulating small-medium enterprises and their operations). 2. 85 people trained, including 15 technicians and 70 women, interested in establishing green energy enterprises and innovation/technologies in Tajikistan. 3. Follow up discussions conducted for introducing the energy access funding platform 4.1 3 banks in Tajikistan identified as main collaborators for the energy access fund 4.2 Two crowd-funding mechanisms identified: Dushanbe Solar City Crowdfunding established in cooperation with SPECEHIVE; Youth Ecological Center platform (www.neruisabz.tj) 4.3 The work is in progress. 5. The work is still ongoing and exact figures to be reported once the small-scale renewable technologies are implemented. 6.1 Feasibility studies completed for the application of 7 mini-grids in off-grid areas of Tajikistan. 6.2 In total, 72 public buildings and private enterprises were screened to identify buildings without access to hot water and electricity. 6.3 Exact numbers are to be reported once the green solutions are implemented.
